newsitem.title: USA: GOLF-PLAY RESUMES IN PGA CHAMPIONSHIP AFTER STORM DELAY.
newsitem.headline: GOLF-PLAY RESUMES IN PGA CHAMPIONSHIP AFTER STORM DELAY.

text.p: Play resumed on Saturday evening in the third round of the PGA Championship after an almost two-hour suspension due to a severe thunderstorm that hit Winged Foot Golf Club.
Twelve players -- led by Davis Love and Justin Leonard at six under par -- had to return to the course to try to complete their rounds after the sudden storm moved out of the region.
Play was halted with Leonard on the 18th hole and Love about to putt on the 15th green.
They were both five strokes ahead of Lee Janzen, who was playing with Love in the final pairing, and Jeff Maggert, who had finished 15 holes.
